etymology.description: semantic: 刂 (dāo, "knife") + phonetic: another part representing 刀 (dāo, "knife") -> initial separation meaning; changed to add 彐 (jì, "snout") later -> become separate -> final form to express concepts related to separation or differentiation
etymology.interpretation: The character 别(別) (bié, "separate") incorporates 刂(dāo, "knife"), symbolizing cutting or dividing, with a phonetic component that originally represented another knife, indicating parting or separating. The addition of 彐(jì, "snout") might have been a later addition to clarify pronunciation or sand for the semantic distinction in usage.
etymology.simplification: 别(別): 刂(卩) dropped top to combine two components into a simpler character.

examples.chinese: 别走(別走)，我们以后再见(我們以後再見)。
examples.pinyin: Bié zǒu, wǒmen yǐhòu zài jiàn.

examples.chinese: 在分别时(在別離時)，保持冷静(保持冷靜)。
examples.english: At the time of parting, keep calm.
